intro: Alchornea brevistyla, commonly known as the short-styled alchornea, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa and the Americas. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves that are typically hairy on the underside. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Alchornea brevistyla is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
